It all comes down to this: this tricky psychology can be seen in two ways! I kept waiting for you, and then you showed up! My heart was racing. 

“Why did you even come? Do you remember your laughter when you walked in? I noticed it clearly, but if I hadn’t been waiting for you, I might not have noticed it at all. A mood can really change how we see things! Mr. Razumihin—ah, that stone where things were hidden! I can picture it in a kitchen garden. You told Zametov about it, and then you mentioned it in my office. When we started breaking down your article, you explained it in a way that could mean two different things, like there was a hidden meaning.

“So, Rodion Romanovitch, I reached my limit, and after hitting my head against a post, I asked myself what I was doing. I thought, you can see it differently if you want, and honestly, that makes more sense. I was confused! I decided I needed to find some small fact. When I heard about the bell-ringing, I held my breath and felt nervous. ‘Here’s my little fact,’ I thought, and I didn’t want to think about it too much. I would have paid a lot to see you with my own eyes when you walked next to that worker after he called you a murderer, and you didn’t dare to ask him anything the whole way. And what about your shaking? What happened there?

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The narrative explores the complexities of human psychology and perception, emphasizing how mood and expectation can influence one's interpretation of events.
